node.statement: (Wick expansion of the interaction difference) By Wick calculus, DeltaV_eps(phi) = V_eps(phi-psi) - V_eps(phi) decomposes as: (Cubic) -4 lambda integral psi_eps :phi_eps^3:_{C_eps} dx; (Quadratic) +6 lambda integral psi_eps^2 :phi_eps^2:_{C_eps} dx; (Linear) integral (-4 lambda psi_eps^3 - 2 delta_m_eps^2 psi_eps) phi_eps dx; (Constant) integral (lambda psi_eps^4 + delta_m_eps^2 psi_eps^2) dx. No new UV divergences arise in the cubic or quadratic Wick-power terms. The only divergent contribution is the linear term 2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi_eps, phi_eps>, which diverges because delta_m_eps^2 -> infinity.
